column3: Great job on this non-trivial CS1 lab!
Nice job with the one line flip_vertical()!
The code could be a lot more efficient with fewer loops.
flip_vertical(): Sequences do not need to be manually reversed. [::-1] will do that.
transform_img: an if isn't needed to determine which function to apply: iterate over transforms
Meaningful, descriptive variable names would make code much easier to read/debug
range() is really only needed in greenscreen, where you need the pixel locations. All other functions can iterate directly over the elements.
flip_vertical() can be just one line
flip_horizontal(): the 2 lines in the loop body can be converted to one.
greenscreen(): The default start index for range() is 0. No need to explicitly state it.
Comments are needed for more complex chunks of code.
Too many comments also makes code difficult to navigate/read! Try to just get at the bare minimum of functionality/explanation.
On commenting: if an in-line comments goes off the screen, place it _above_ the code its commenting, and if it's still long, give it a second line
Do not remove the docstrings (comments between the ''' ...''') at the top of functions: they're VERY useful!
Unnecessary print() statements should be removed before submitting the assignment
